definition: the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature, namely: A Dream of Red Mansions 紅樓夢|红楼梦[Hong2 lou2 Meng4], Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
four/4
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply

sentences.english: Mansions" is one of China's four famous book !"
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道“紅樓夢”是中國的四大名著之一。

sentences.english: I heard there are four masterpieces of China.Have you read all of them?
sentences.chinese: 我聽說中國有四大名著，你都讀過嗎？

sentences.english: I heard there are four masterpieces of China.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說中國有四大名著，你都讀過嗎？

sentences.english: Lily: How's your feeling after reading the four classics?
sentences.chinese: 你讀完四大名著有什麼感受？

sentences.english: Hi! Hong. I heard there are four masterpieces of China. Have you read all of them?
sentences.chinese: 你好，林紅。我聽說中國有四大名著，你都讀過嗎？

sentences.english: We all know that "A Dream of Red Mansions" is one of China's four famous book !
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道“紅樓夢”是中國的四大名著之一。

sentences.english: Abstract: [to] picked: "jinghuayuan" is one of the four great classics of ancient Chinese ghost story.
sentences.chinese: 《鏡花緣》是我國古代神怪小說四大名著之一。

sentences.english: Works based on the Four Masters' Works appear constantly on television.
sentences.chinese: 由四大名著改編的電視作品經常被搬上熒屏。

definition: masterpiece
Journey to the West, Ming dynasty novel by Wu Cheng'en 吳承恩|吴承恩, one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature/also called Pilgrimage to the West or Monkey
A Dream of Red Mansions (first completed edition 1791) by Cao Xueqin 曹雪芹[Cao2 Xue3 qin2], one of the four great novels
Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus (1617), Ming dynasty vernacular novel, formerly notorious and banned for its sexual content
Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh by Shi Nai'an 施耐庵[Shi1 Nai4 an1], one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature
the Twenty-Four Histories (25 or 26 in modern editions), collection of books on Chinese dynastic history from 3000 BC till 17th century/fig. a long and complicated story

Romance of the Three Kingdoms by Luo Guanzhong 羅貫中|罗贯中[Luo2 Guan4 zhong1], one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature/a fictional account of the Three Kingdoms at the break-up of the Han around 200 AD, consistently portraying Liu Bei's Shu Han 劉備|刘备, 蜀漢|蜀汉 as virtuous heroes and Cao Cao's Wei 曹操, 魏 as tyrannical villains
edge of the water/shore or sea, lake or river/seashore
Strange Stories from a Chinese Studio, Qing dynasty book of tales by 蒲松齡|蒲松龄[Pu2 Song1 ling2]
Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
classical literature
supernatural novel/novel of ghosts and goblins
Sanxia wuyi (lit. Three knight-errants and five righteous one), novel edited from stories of late Qing dynasty pinghua 評話|评话 master storyteller Shi Yukun 石玉昆
novel in chapters, main format for long novels from the Ming onwards, with each chapter headed by a summary couplet
popular fiction/light literature
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅
